content.question:
A ball is thrown vertically up into the air from a height of <math alttext="2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> above the ground with an initial velocity of <math alttext="positive 15 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></mpadded><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. If air resistance is ignored, which of the following pairs could be a possible height and velocity of the ball at some point along its trajectory after it is thrown but before it reaches the ground?
HeightVelocityA<math alttext="0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math><math alttext="negative 15 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>15</mn></mpadded><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>B<math alttext="2.5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.5</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math><math alttext="positive 5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mpadded><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>C<math alttext="7 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math><math alttext="positive 18 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mpadded><mn>8</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>D<math alttext="12 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math><math alttext="negative 5 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mpadded><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
